items.title: ✈️ A cargo aircraft skids off a Hong Kong runway into the sea, killing 2 airport workers
items.standfirst: A cargo aircraft skidded off a Hong Kong runway and collided with a security patrol car before both fell into the sea early Monday, killing the two people in the car.
items.content: A cargo aircraft skidded off a Hong Kong runway and collided with a security patrol car before both fell into the sea early Monday, killing the two people in the car.

items.content: The Emirates cargo flight hit a vehicle on the ground after it landed at the international airport.

items.title: Two ground staff killed at Hong Kong airport after cargo plane skids off runway

items.content: Two people died when a cargo plane coming from Dubai struck a ground service vehicle and skidded off the runway and into the sea at Hong Kong International Airport.

items.title: Two ground staff killed at Hong Kong airport after cargo plane and vehicle go into the sea

items.content: Two people were killed Monday when a cargo plane skidded off a runway at Hong Kong International Airport after it struck a ground service vehicle, sending both the plane and the vehicle into the sea, officials said.

items.content: A cargo plane has skidded off the runway into the sea while landing at Hong Kong International Airport, killing two people on the ground.

clusters.title: Search for suspects in heist at Paris' Louvre Museum
clusters.neutral_headline: Thieves Steal Jewels from Louvre Museum in Paris

items.title: Search for suspects in heist at Paris' Louvre Museum
items.standfirst: Thieves used a crane on Sunday morning to smash an upstairs window at the Louvre Museum in Paris. The suspects made off with priceless jewels and still have not been located. CBS News' Elizabeth Palmer reports.
items.content: Thieves used a crane on Sunday morning to smash an upstairs window at the Louvre Museum in Paris. The suspects made off with priceless jewels and still have not been located. CBS News' Elizabeth Palmer reports.

items.title: This isn't the Louvre's first high-profile heist. Here's a history of earlier thefts
items.standfirst: Masked thieves stole priceless jewels from the Louvre on Sunday morning. The Paris museum has suffered a string of successful art heists, dating back to the theft of the Mona Lisa in 1911.
items.content: Daily Scene in the Louvre, a 1911 cartoon by Samuel Ehrhart, shows patrons blatantly stealing works from the museum after an inventory at the time found that over 300 canvases were missing.'/>Masked thieves stole priceless jewels from the Louvre on Sunday morning. The Paris museum has suffered a string of successful art heists, dating back to the theft of the Mona Lisa in 1911.(Image credit: Universal History Archive)

items.title: What was stolen from the Louvre? Police hunt thieves after daring daytime heist
items.standfirst: Thieves who broke into Paris' Louvre Museum made off with priceless Napoleonic jewelry including diamond encrusted crowns, tiaras necklaces and earings.
items.content: Thieves who broke into Paris' Louvre Museum made off with priceless Napoleonic jewelry including diamond encrusted crowns, tiaras necklaces and earings.

items.title: What will happen to stolen Louvre jewellery?
items.standfirst: A number of "priceless" objects were stolen from the Louvre in Paris, in what has been called the "theft of the decade".
items.content: A number of "priceless" objects were stolen from the Louvre in Paris, in what has been called the "theft of the decade".

items.title: The 'priceless' jewels stolen from Louvre revealed: As experts say police face 'race against time'

items.content: Police face "a race against time" to recover "priceless" objects stolen by thieves in a daring heist at the Louvre museum in Paris, Sky News has been told.

ai_summary: Thieves used a crane to break into the Louvre Museum in Paris.

Police are racing against time to recover the stolen items.
The theft is being called the "theft of the decade".
The Louvre has experienced previous high-profile art heists.

items.standfirst: Crash that hit apps and websites around world demonstrates ‘urgent need for diversification in cloud computing’Business live – latest updatesExperts have warned of the perils of relying on a small number of companies for operating the global internet after a glitch at Amazon’s cloud computing service brought down apps and websites around the world.The affected platforms included Snapchat, Roblox, Signal and Duolingo as well as a host of Amazon-owned operations including its main retail site and the Ring doorbell company. items.title: Millions protest Trump administration in "No Kings" demonstrations across U.S.
items.standfirst: Millions of people peacefully protested against the Trump administration over the weekend in cities across the U.S. as part of the so-called "No Kings" movement. Demonstrators pushed back against President Trump's policies on immigration, domestic use of the military, environmental rollbacks and more. Some Republicans, including House Speaker Mike Johnson, described the protests as anti-American.

Some Republicans, including House Speaker Mike Johnson, described the protests as anti-American.

items.content: Rodrigo Paz's win shows Bolivians want change, but he faces economic challenges after almost 20 years of socialist rule.

items.title: Centrist Rodrigo Paz wins Bolivia's presidential runoff, topping right-wing rival
items.standfirst: Centrist senator Rodrigo Paz won Bolivia's presidency with 54% of the vote, ending 20 years of rule by the Movement Toward Socialism party amid economic turmoil.
items.content: Centrist senator Rodrigo Paz won Bolivia's presidency with 54% of the vote, ending 20 years of rule by the Movement Toward Socialism party amid economic turmoil.(Image credit: Natacha Pisarenko)

items.title: Rodrigo Paz Pereira wins Bolivia’s presidential runoff marking a new shift to the right
items.standfirst: Sunday’s election marked the first time since 2005 that no candidate from Evo Morales’ Mas party was on the ballotCentre-right senator Rodrigo Paz Pereira, 58, won Bolivia’s presidential runoff on Sunday and will be the country’s next president, marking a shift to the right after nearly 20 years of dominance by the leftist Movimiento al Socialismo (Mas) party.With just over 97% of ballots counted in the electoral court’s “preliminary” tally, Paz Pereira secured 54.6% of the vote, while rightwing former president Jorge “Tuto” Quiroga received 45.4%. Continue reading...
items.content: Sunday’s election marked the first time since 2005 that no candidate from Evo Morales’ Mas party was on the ballotCentre-right senator Rodrigo Paz Pereira, 58, won Bolivia’s presidential runoff on Sunday and will be the country’s next president, marking a shift to the right after nearly 20 years of dominance by the leftist Movimiento al Socialismo (Mas) party.With just over 97% of ballots counted in the electoral court’s “preliminary” tally, Paz Pereira secured 54.6% of the vote, while rightwing former president Jorge “Tuto” Quiroga received 45.4%. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Rodrigo Paz won Bolivia's presidential runoff election.

items.title: Met police to end non-crime hate investigations after Graham Linehan case
items.standfirst: Father Ted co-creator to sue force for wrongful arrest after CPS drops proceedings over social media posts about trans issues The Met police have said they will no longer investigate non-crime hate incidents as the Father Ted co-creator Graham Linehan was informed that no further action would be taken after his arrest over social media posts.Five armed officers detained the 57-year-old comedy writer at Heathrow in September on suspicion of inciting violence in relation to three posts about trans issues. items.standfirst: Officials confirm reports that Takaichi’s Liberal Democratic party will join forces with rightwing Nippon IshinSanae Takaichi is on course to become Japan’s first female prime minister this week after her party agreed to form a new coalition with a minor party.Officials confirmed on Monday that Takaichi’s Liberal Democratic party (LDP) had joined forces with the rightwing Nippon Ishin (Japan Innovation party), which shares her hawkish stance on China and support for restrictions on immigration. Continue reading...
items.content: Officials confirm reports that Takaichi’s Liberal Democratic party will join forces with rightwing Nippon IshinSanae Takaichi is on course to become Japan’s first female prime minister this week after her party agreed to form a new coalition with a minor party.Officials confirmed on Monday that Takaichi’s Liberal Democratic party (LDP) had joined forces with the rightwing Nippon Ishin (Japan Innovation party), which shares her hawkish stance on China and support for restrictions on immigration. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Sanae Takaichi is likely to become Japan's first female prime minister.
Her governing party secured a crucial coalition partner.
Takaichi's party will join forces with Nippon Ishin.
Nippon Ishin shares her hawkish stance on China.
She supports restrictions on immigration.

clusters.title: Louvre heist puts pressure on French government over museum security
clusters.neutral_headline: Louvre Museum Suffers Heist, Prompting Security Review

items.title: Louvre heist puts pressure on French government over museum security
items.standfirst: Justice minister says ‘we have failed’ after thieves take seven minutes to steal priceless jewels from museumThe French government is under increasing pressure over museum security as police continued to search for thieves who took seven minutes to steal priceless jewels from the Louvre, the world’s most visited museum.“What is certain is that we have failed, since people were able to park a furniture hoist in the middle of Paris, get people up it in several minutes to grab priceless jewels, and give France a terrible image,” the justice minister, Gérald Darmanin, told France Inter radio on Monday. Continue reading...
items.content: Justice minister says ‘we have failed’ after thieves take seven minutes to steal priceless jewels from museumThe French government is under increasing pressure over museum security as police continued to search for thieves who took seven minutes to steal priceless jewels from the Louvre, the world’s most visited museum.“What is certain is that we have failed, since people were able to park a furniture hoist in the middle of Paris, get people up it in several minutes to grab priceless jewels, and give France a terrible image,” the justice minister, Gérald Darmanin, told France Inter radio on Monday. Continue reading...

items.title: 'Police are racing against the clock' to recover the jewels stolen from the Louvre
items.standfirst: The Louvre remained closed Monday following a bold daylight heist in which thieves stole priceless Napoleonic jewels by scaling the museum’s facade and breaking in through a window. The theft, which occurred with visitors already inside, has prompted French authorities to reassess security at cultural sites nationwide. Justice Minister Gérald Darmanin admitted to serious security failures, while police continue an intense investigation to track down the perpetrators, as FRANCE 24's Claire Paccalin explains.
items.content: The Louvre remained closed Monday following a bold daylight heist in which thieves stole priceless Napoleonic jewels by scaling the museum’s facade and breaking in through a window. The theft, which occurred with visitors already inside, has prompted French authorities to reassess security at cultural sites nationwide. Justice Minister Gérald Darmanin admitted to serious security failures, while police continue an intense investigation to track down the perpetrators, as FRANCE 24's Claire Paccalin explains.

items.title: Louvre jewellery heist sparks security debate in France
items.standfirst: A group of thieves disguised as construction workers stole eight priceless Napoleonic jewels from the Louvre in a swift, seven-minute daylight raid. The theft has ignited a debate over museum security, with French officials condemning the serious lapses that damaged the country's image. Authorities believe the burglary was orchestrated by organized crime and have launched a large-scale manhunt. The Louvre remains closed as the investigation continues amid plans to modernize and strengthen its security systems.
items.content: A group of thieves disguised as construction workers stole eight priceless Napoleonic jewels from the Louvre in a swift, seven-minute daylight raid. The theft has ignited a debate over museum security, with French officials condemning the serious lapses that damaged the country's image. Authorities believe the burglary was orchestrated by organized crime and have launched a large-scale manhunt. The Louvre remains closed as the investigation continues amid plans to modernize and strengthen its security systems.

items.title: Louvre heist: Manhunt underway as security issues come to light
items.standfirst: A group of thieves recently stole extremely valuable jewelry from the Louvre Museum. Authorities have launched a manhunt to find the suspects. This incident has raised serious concerns about the museum’s security and whether more needs to be done to protect its priceless collections. FRANCE 24's Ellen Gainsford has updates on the investigation and security measures.
items.content: A group of thieves recently stole extremely valuable jewelry from the Louvre Museum. Authorities have launched a manhunt to find the suspects. This incident has raised serious concerns about the museum’s security and whether more needs to be done to protect its priceless collections. FRANCE 24's Ellen Gainsford has updates on the investigation and security measures.

ai_summary: Thieves stole priceless jewels from the Louvre in a seven-minute daylight raid.
The French government faces pressure due to security failures at the museum.
Authorities are investigating the theft, suspecting organized criminal involvement.
The Louvre remains closed as officials reassess and modernize security systems.
Justice Minister admitted serious security failures, damaging France's image.

items.content: The Federal Trade Commission removed several blog posts in recent months about open source and potential risks to consumers from the rapid spread of commercial AI tools.

clusters.title: EU moves to ban Russian energy imports by 2028
clusters.neutral_headline: EU Plans to Phase Out Russian Energy Imports by 2028

items.title: EU moves to ban Russian energy imports by 2028
items.standfirst: A draft regulation approved by European Union energy ministers would phase out Russian import contracts by January 2028.
items.content: A draft regulation approved by European Union energy ministers would phase out Russian import contracts by January 2028.

items.title: European Union to phase out Russian gas imports by end of 2027
items.standfirst: The European Union will phase out all Russian gas imports by the end of next year, the bloc’s energy ministers agreed on Monday. Although diplomats said that Hungary and Slovakia – which are diplomatically closer to the Kremlin and still import Russian gas via pipeline – both opposed the move.
items.content: The European Union will phase out all Russian gas imports by the end of next year, the bloc’s energy ministers agreed on Monday. Although diplomats said that Hungary and Slovakia – which are diplomatically closer to the Kremlin and still import Russian gas via pipeline – both opposed the move.

ai_summary: The European Union will phase out Russian gas imports by the end of 2027.
A draft regulation aims to end Russian import contracts by January 2028.
Hungary and Slovakia opposed the move, still importing Russian gas.
